Key Match Events: Jaden Ivey scored 22 points before suffering a potentially serious left leg injury
Detroit Pistons shot 64.1 percent from the field in the first half
Ivey had 16 points and Cunningham scored 12 as they combined to make all seven of their 3-point attempts
Orlando scored on its first three possessions of the second half, prompting a Pistons timeout
Detroit quickly pushed the lead to 18, 73-55, on another 3-pointer by Ivey off a feed from Cunningham
Suggs then sparked an Orlando rally, contributing six points, a block and an assist during a 14-1 run
The Pistons pulled away again. Duren scored on a putback and Harris made a jumper. Hardaway hit a midrange shot, and Harris converted a bank shot to make it 101-90
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ivey was injured when Orlando’s Cole Anthony dove for a loose ball early in the fourth quarter and crashed into Ivey’s leg. He left the court on a stretcher.
